qas.question: London's residential property value is equivalent to what nation's GDP?
What is the average price of property per square meter in central London as of April 2014?
A World Property Journal report has ranked London as the most expensive office market in the world for how many consecutive years?
What city has the highest prices for property in Europe?
What is the average property price per square meter in Berlin as of April 2014?

context: <a3_0>London<a3_0/> is the world's most expensive office market for the last <a2_0>three<a2_0/> years according to world property journal (2015) report. As of 2015[update] the residential property in London is worth $2.2 trillion - same value as that of <a0_0>Brazil<a0_0/> annual GDP. The city has the highest property prices of any European city according to the Office for National Statistics and the European Office of Statistics. On average the price per square metre in central London is <a1_0>€24,252<a1_0/> (April 2014). This is higher than the property prices in other G8 European capital cities; Berlin <a4_0>€3,306<a4_0/>, Rome €6,188 and Paris €11,229.
